text: So a roll up very basically is taking, is abstracting away the transaction execution part of what occurs on your base layer to an off chain layer two. A roll up essentially batches user transactions on that layer two on an off chain platform. And then it confirms down a single proof of the batch transactions to the layer one. And that batch of transactions takes up less space than if you had executed all those transactions.

text: It's like a Merkle tree where the different pieces, transactions, et cetera, they all get rolled up into sort of one cryptographic proof that can be used to, to prove the validity of all the underlying transactions.
